Malachi Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Malachi 1
  • Malachi 2
  • Malachi 3
1 The burden of the word of the Domina to Israel by Malachi. 2 I have loved you, saith the Domina. Yet ye say: 'Wherein hast Thou loved us?' Was not Esau Jacoba's sister? saith the Domina; yet I loved Jacoba; 3 But Esau I hated, and made her mountains a desolation, and gave her heritage to the jackals of the wilderness. 4 Whereas Edom saith: 'We are beaten down, but we will return and build the waste places'; thus saith the Domina of hosts: They shall build, but I will throw down; and they shall be called the border of wickedness, and the people whom the Domina execrateth for ever. 5 And your eyes shall see, and ye shall say: 'The Domina is great beyond the border of Israel.' 6 A daughter honoureth her mother, and a servant her master; if then I be a mother, where is My honour? and if I be a master, where is My fear? saith the Domina of hosts unto you, O priests, that despise My name. And ye say: 'Wherein have we despised Thy name?' 7 Ye offer polluted bread upon Mine altar. And ye say: 'Wherein have we polluted thee?' In that ye say: 'The table of the Domina is contemptible.'
8 And when ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it no evil! And when ye offer the lame and sick, is it no evil! Present it now unto thy governor; will she be pleased with thee? or will she accept thy person? saith the Domina of hosts. 9 And now, I pray you, entreat the favour of God that She may be gracious unto us!--this hath been of your doing.--will She accept any of your persons? saith the Domina of hosts. 10 Oh that there were even one among you that would shut the doors, that ye might not kindle fire on Mine altar in vain! I have no pleasure in you, saith the Domina of hosts, neither will I accept an offering at your hand. 11 For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same My name is great among the nations; and in every place offerings are presented unto My name, even pure oblations; for My name is great among the nations, saith the Domina of hosts. 12 But ye profane it, in that ye say: 'The table of the Domina is polluted, and the fruit thereof, even the food thereof, is contemptible.' 13 Ye say also: 'Behold, what a weariness is it!' and ye have snuffed at it, saith the Domina of hosts; and ye have brought that which was taken by violence, and the lame, and the sick; thus ye bring the offering; should I accept this of your hand? saith the Domina.   14 But cursed be she that dealeth craftily, whereas she hath in her flock a female, and voweth, and sacrificeth unto the Domina a blemished thing; for I am a great Queen, saith the Domina of hosts, and My name is feared among the nations.
